review: Curbside is a joke! I showed up on time and watched the staff mess around for 20 minutes or so. I sat there just to see how long it would take. I saw two other curbside folks wait and eventually walk in. They got there food as soon as they walked in. I waited another 10 minutes. Eventually I walked in and he said "oh, I didn't see you there". Are you serious??! Grabbed my cold food and threw them a one dollar bill!! I want my dollar back!! Y'all are terrible!!!!!

This particular Chili's has had its ups and downs. I "like" it, and I "don't like it"; all at the same time. I guess it depends on what time of the day you go and who's working there when you go. I've had both, good and bad experiences here. It's 'hit and miss' with me as far as the service that I get when I do go.

I'm not a huge fan of Chili's to begin with. I used to work at one and went through the menu several times while there so I'm pretty burned out on it. But I have to say, some of the things they are supposed to do best are just mediocre. I had the fajitas. The tortillas were stale and the meat was tough. The service was decent and our server was pleasant. If you like Chili's then this is about as good as any of them. If you're looking to find a new experience, try something else.

I guess when businesses are in a small town, the service goes downhill because there is no competition. This is exactly how this Chili's operates. I'm pretty sure the lackluster service starts from the top down, considering the manager just adopted a new rule of only filling the beer glass up to the top of the handle and the rest is head. His excuse? "It's company policy." Hey, don't lie to me, I go to other Chili's. The other thing that really ticked me off about this location, was when I went for lunch and ordered water with lemon. The waitress told me they were out of lemons and get this, "they were too busy to go and cut some more." Fail.

So, I'm updating from 2 stars to 1. My brother and I decided to go out for lunch.  Only God knows why, but I decided on the Chili's in Forney.   It was about 2 pm on a very slow weekday and as we enter there was no hostess, so we just waited and talked.  We waited and waited for 10 minutes and no one came.  Teenage waiters looked disinterested and disappeared into the kitchen.  Don't eat here.  Bad service, mediocre food (even for the already low Chili's standards).

Forney, Texas. Food was good. Service was lousy. Once we got our food, didn't see waitress again until we were finished. She asked if we wanted more tea. Not now, we're finished. Our waitress wasn't even the person we paid. Won't go back.

This a followup review after the disaster we encountered the first time. The district manager said the staff was getting retrained. He gave us a bunch of gift certificates to try them again. When it comes to restaurants I'm a forgiving person once...never twice. Well we gave the Forney Chili's another try and I was surprised by the turnaround on our latest visit. People in party: 6 (3 adults, 1 teenager and 2 kids) Day: Sunday Time: 5:00pm Drink Arrival: Very fast, refills were on the spot Appetizers: Ordered 20 wings (which were tasty but a little on the small size) and the Southwest sampler platter (very good) Our waiter was Great, orders were right and drinks were refilled promptly. The wait staff didn't look so confused like the last time and they were organized. We really enjoyed our dinner this time.
Would rather hit Applebees everytime... Nothing is great here. Food is so so and service is less than memorable.

Unfortunately I need to add on the pile of bad reviews. This is the worst Chili's we have been to yet. The food was mediocre, drinks were not refilled unless you asked and we were served food that definitely sat under a heat lamp way too long. See the picture of the pickles I uploaded. We tried this location 3 times and each one was worse than the next. This was the straw that broke the camels back. We will just make the trip out to Rockwall.

This is probably the worst Chili's I have ever been to.  The service is really what killed it.  I asked for the guacamole burger because I could not remember exactly what it was called.  The server told me they no longer had that burger.  So I asked if they had avocados and she said "oh yes of course!" So I asked if she could just add avocados to my burger and that just blew her mind, I had to spell it out for her.  Especially whenever I place an order over the phone, I am always leery as to if it will be correct at all.  Food is great, but if you want service- don't go here.

Worst service I've ever had in a restaurant. Servers were slow or non-existent. I'm usually very understanding and I'm used to busy nights but the entire time I was there there were 4 to 6 servers standing in the back talking.

Awful service! Went for dinner at 10pm to find the hostess on his phone and told us to sit ourselves in the bar area. We then walked over to the bar area which had about 8 empty tables, all of which were dirty. My husband asked someone to clean a table, who did so begrudgingly as he told us his shift was almost over. We then sat down for 10 minutes as servers walked by us and never stopped. We finally left when it became clear no one was going to wait on us. Clearly the management was not supervising staff or the quality of service. We have had several experiences at this location getting wrong orders but this was by far the worst. Next time we will go to Applebee's and skip the whole ordeal.

Sufficient, with efficient customer service. I had no problem tipping 20%. The California flat bread was also, sufficient, and I love that they had fresh cut pineapples as an option for the kids side, instead of only french fries.
The food was alright and the service was pretty slow. I wouldn't go back unless I had too.
Ever gotten food poisoning before? You will never forget it after the experience is over! This place doesn't even make sure the dishes are clean during the daytime!
Food is great menus updated nice change.
Food cold and not fully cooked... Asked for salsa didn't get it till after we got our cold food. Needless to say I do not recommend this place

I only gave this place one star because I had to.  The customer service here is non existent.  We came here at 10:30 on a Saturday night and the hostess had to assist us with our order.   Keep in mind, there were only seven other parties seated in the restaurant. The other members of the wait staff were standing around starring at us.  Funny thing is, we were Black and so was the hostess.  I hate to play the race card, but this was blatant in your face racism.  Come on Chilli's of Forney.  This is the year 2015 and all money is green.  Now to blame myself, this is the second and absolute last poor customer service experience I have had at this establishment. Fool me once shame on you, but I am merciful.  Everyone deserves a second chance. You all need to better train employees and get with the times.   I would never call myself a waitress and not acknowledge my customers within 1-5 minutes of being seated. This is a growing area, get over the fact that the town is no longer what you may have envisioned from your early childhood days!  Keep it moving and don't even consider this Chili's location.

I come here a lot, and the food tastes great and the service is always at a nice pace. Today, I went with my parents and I had the Oldtimer without cheese, French fries and a Fresco salad. Everything was great. I highly recommend.

We've been back here many times and seen the great overall improvement.  Service is mush better and the food has been consistently great.  The food brought to the table looks just like in the menu.  The manager is very visible and interactive without being annoying.  You can tell he has a lot of pride in this restaurant. The place is pretty clean overall - some of the seat cushions have damage done to them and patched.  Take advantage of their club for special offers and coupons.  We use one every time we come.

We went on a Sunday around 1PM and the restaurant was packed. The wait wasn't too long, just about 15 minutes and they text you when your table is ready which is convenient considering the waiting area inside is small and waiting outside is more comfortable. PROS:  -The server was friendly and attentive.  -The food was tastey (we got an order of Dr. Pepper BBQ ribs and a sampler).  -The food came out relatively fast considering how crowded it was.  CONS:  -The hostess never informed us that they offer self-seating in the bar area, which is where we wanted to sit to watch the football games. By the time we figured it out, a few groups had come in and sat down ahead of us. It wasn't a big deal, but frustrating nonetheless.  -The silverware was filthy. Fork and knife had bits of food on them. The table also had food underneath it from the previous customers and one of the chairs at our table was covered in food and drink. The dining room looked a little cleaner than the bar area so we'll probably try sitting there next time.  Overall, it wasn't a bad experience. It's a little pricier than Applebee's but you get what you pay for because it's also a bit better in my opinion. We'll go back if we're in the mood for some casual dining.
The waitstaff was very attentive and quick.  Also the food was hot and tasty.  We haven't received service this good in months.

Same old Chili's fired. You know what you're getting. However, the service tends to be at a glacier space. I can't stand it when you have to wait to be seated when they have half an empty restaurant. Especially when you're trying to corral two toddlers.

It's like stealing....I can believe they added more to my bill, on my receipt I wrote/totaled 56.00 on my total which was my bill with the tip together. When I cleared my register two days later, it cleared for 60.00. No one just does that.....they totally just added more of a tip for themselves.

I love Chili's. They have a versatile menu and make a mean margarita! The hubby loves their salmon dish. It's a very heart healthy dish and the broccoli is very d-lish. I would also recommend the Santa Fe chicken salad, super yummy. It has a nice mix of fresh greens with a spicy kick to the Santa Fe sauce and then the alvacado and Ranch bring u back down! Beef fajitas are good but I would highly recommend the Carnita tacos with cilantro rice and black beans,  top notch! If u are in the mood to relax at the bar, defiantly try the Platinum Presidente Margarita. It was so good I had to Jack the recipe and make them myself!!!!  Also, if u need a little snack to accompany. Try some chips and salsa with your premium margarita!

It's chilis, most are about the same. The service is good here, the majority of the time. Food is good, but what I am upset about is the take out side. I walk in and order one bowl of potato soup. How can you mess that up? I pay $4 something for a BOWL. I get home and I see what looks like a "cup" size container, and it's HALF FULL. wtf. I paid almost $5 for a few spoonfuls of soup. If I go back, I will be checking my order thoroughly before I leave. Who thinks to check if their order of soup is messed up? Not cool.

Well we decided to give Chili's another try. We are 45 minutes in and still have not received our food. Our waitress is very good and do not feel she is to blame, but this is my last time here.  We have given this Chili's several chances and every time the wait is ridiculous.

Every single time we try to go here it's ridiculous. The wait is an hour, service is bearable, another hour to get the food, and 2 hours of our lives lost forever.  More restaurants are needed in this area like Chili's. Maybe that will take some pressure of this place.

Horrible.  Awful  unprofessional. . And all the other negative things you can think of.  Ordered food got food.  Needed refills never saw waitress again nor did any other employee walking by asked if we needed anything. Finished food still no waitress. Paid bill  on the machine on the table  as we were getting up she comes ro table and says "sorry I know I was a bad waitress """ really a big idiot.   Last time we will ever to this Chili's in forney  texaa

This Chilis first opened up when I was in middle school and we used to hang out here a lot after the movies. I never really thought much of the chilis at the time.  As time has gone on and they have revamped their menu my boyfriend and I always find ourselves here. There is something on the menu for everyone. I always seem to want Mexican and he wants wings or a steak. We can find that all here and it all taste amazing! The wait is long, however you can always sit in the bar area when a table gets up. They will clean it for you, just be patient.  Stuff we had tried that we would recommend are the presidente margaritas, sliders, fried pickles, guacamole, white queso, wings, SOUTHWESTERN EGG ROLLS!!!,loaded baked potato soup, chicken enchilada soup, southwestern BLT sand which, all of the fresh mex bowls and last but not least the Cajun pasta. There are so many other things that sound good but some of these things are so good we always order them! I always forget to take pictures but I will do so next time I am there!  Our favorite waiter is Hayden. He has waited on us a few times in the bar and he is always good and assertive. We also like Travis and Brittany!
Very few options in Forney. Typical Chili's (or chain restaurant) experience. Sub-par food, sub-par service. Food is not bad, but also isn't good. Walk away thinking... That was a waste of time/money

We usually have good service and get good food here. The whole family likes to come here for lunch or dinner. There have been times where we have had bad servers or the food wasn't cooked right, but the managers have always been quick to remedy the situation.

Food was decent. Apparently I went on a busy day it was Veterans day the whole crew seemed a little irritated like they were tired of serving Vets free foods? Don't know... Maybe they weren't getting tipped on the free food. I'm use to Las Vegas (where were from) where they have to earn their tips (To Insure Proper Service - tips) The only reason I loved going to Chili's was for the Country Fried Steak  my favorite! Wasn't on the menu anymore but they said it was still available, but they were out... What? So I had the Chicken Strips with fries. It was OK batter was pretty soggy, fries were cold. Wife had Fajitas she said it was pretty good. Had the Ole Chips and Salsa or should I say salt crumbs. So much salt and all the chips were broken into little pieces like it was the bottom of the chips. I sure hope next time is better and they have Chicken Fried Steak otherwise it will be my last.

Been a customer here quite a few times, which tells you the food and service I've received must be good. More often than not recently I've been a pick-up customer and the orders have been ready when expected and correct. The folks in the pick-up area have been pleasant and made sure the orders were correct before we left. I think it did take the location a while to find it's legs but seems to be doing really well now.
Went with some friends to this Chili's, my salad was great but service was kind of rude and slow. And I was charged the wrong amount & never saw a receipt.

This was the best dining experience I've had in a while. Went to eat about an hour ago with my wife. They have totally redone their menu and it is GREAT. They stepped up their game. Our server, I really wish I remembered her name, was excellent(her name started with T). She was very attentive and polite and it was a great overall experience. The manager was super nice as well, stopped by to check on us and talk about new menu items and what not. We will definitely be back, dry rub ribs and loaded boneless wings are the best. Thanks Chili's in Forney for total greatness!

Chili's is not usually our preferred place to eat but we decided to give it go. The service was excellent and while the food is never out of this world great it was good and they had a pretty decent special going on that made easy on the pocketbook so overall a win/win!
The food and service seem to be inconsistent, but we have always enjoyed our servers. While I won't frequent the place, I would come back at a later date.
Wait was entirely too long to get the food we ordered. I wanted a rare steak and got medium well. The picture of the shrimps look huge but in reality they are tiny.

Good food!  I've dined at this particular Chili's for years and it's my favorite Chili's.  If I don't dine inside I pick up "to go".  I have eaten here two or more times in one week.  Highly recommend.

By far the worst customer service I've ever experienced!!!! I ordered a medium well steak that came out extra well done. My husband ordered a burger and it came out bloody. When the waitress came to retrieve our food, she took my plate back to the kitchen then brought me back the same sides without the steak and reached in my husbands plate to grab his burger off his plate with her bare hands. Unfortunately there aren't many dining options in Forney, but I can guarantee that we will not be back to this location!!!!!

We dined at the dinner rush on a Saturday and only waited 23 minutes, this was faster than usual and a welcome perk. Food was hot and out fast, drinks were full the whole time. Only problems were my  quesadilla salad was probably had some time under a heat lamp and the rice with the fajitas was just not eatable. It didn't even smell good. Don't leave without trying the loaded boneless wings. Not for the health conscious but they are great!
